content.description: SIt start the arête and move up and top out. The crux is about 3/4 of the way up.
content.location: This ascends the far left arête if you are facing the steep, long side of the block.

content.description: Sit start the right side. Move up to match on a jug. Swing left to a crimp and top out up slopey arete.
content.location: This problem is on a decent sized boulder that sits near a vernal pool about 100 feet away from the Bullet Boulder.

content.description: This is a really nice line that begins as a sit at the right arete. Start on the good ledge with bad feet, and move up right to the jug in the cavity. Follow the finger crack out right and up. Round the corner of the block, and follow the crack over the lip. This is long, pumpy, tricky, and fun!
content.location: It is on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with left hand in the decent pod in the crack/seam and right hand on a small crimp and fire way up to a flat, crescent-shaped hold. Match and top out. Definitely harder for shorter folks.
content.location: Start about 5-6 feet right of the far left arête on the longest steep side of the boulder.

content.description: On the slab side, climb the obvious crack.
content.location: It is on the slab side facing the trail.

content.description: Sit start just left of a small tree at the blunt arete on the far side of the slab. Using an incut pocket and an edge direct below it, pull off the ground, and bump your way up the arete. Stay off the slab to the right. Climb up the arete till you reach the horizontal crack. Good luck finding the foot holds.
content.location: It is on the far left side of the slab.

content.description: Sit start on a good ledge with bad feet, and go either up left or up right. Follow the weakness up, and trend left to gain a finger crack for the topout.
content.location: This is on the right side of the main face.

content.description: Step into the wall in the shallow scoop with nothing to hold onto. Dyno, jump, balance, and levitate yourself up to the large break in the crack.
content.location: This is just left of the slab side of the boulder located between 95 Proof and Font Style.

climbs.name: A Little Slab Will Do Ya!

content.description: Climb the low angle slab with no obvious holds. Start just about one foot left of the tree with a left foot in a semicircle dish. Climb straight up to the peak.
content.location: It is on the slab side of boulder as you approach from the trail.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a good edge low on the face and your right hand on a higher crimp just around the arete. With a good left foot and a scummy right smear, reach up with left hand to a good slot/crack on left side of the arete. Angle just around the arete, and finish straight up using the cool "bullet holes" for some key feet. You can also finish out on The High Right Traverse if you like, but I liked the feel of just going straight up. There is a sit to this that I imagine has gone as well.
content.protection: Pad(s), if you can use a heel hook on this, watch out for the block on the ground.
content.location: This is on the arete to the right of "Easy Arete".

content.description: The Bullet Boulder is a single, big block near the compost dump.
